attributes.action: Force Trading Standards to Investigate Fraud carried out by Companies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Trading Standards are refusing to Act in accordance to the Parliamentary Acts of Law.  they state they do not investigation Fraud, carried out by Companies, they passed my case to Consumer Direct, who made the same claim.
I Petition,  Trading Standards to act according to the Powers Given to them to enforce the following, Consumer Protection ACT 1987, European Communities ACT 1972, Fair Trading Act 1973, Health and Safty Act 1974, Property Misdescription Act 1991, Trade Description Act 1968, Administration of justice Act 1970, Malicious Communications Act 1988, These acts have not been enforced by Trading Standards, they now claim because 3 years have passed they cannot do anything.
I have written to you prime Minister earlier this year, regarding Trading Standards refusing to investigate Fraud, carried out by a leading Home Improvements Company. the Police have stated that Trading Standards should have investigated, but are  allowing Major Fraud to take Place, the company involved is been seen to be employing  criminals, and benefits cheats, many of these have been caught this year, but a lot of the fraud still continues, today, costing the Tax Payer Dearly.
